"Beverley Hills" - Unique Rooftop Residence
At the top of one of Melbourne's most iconic architectural masterpieces designed in 1935 by Howard Lawson, this unique penthouse surrounds a roof-top terrace and commands sensational views of the Yarra River, city skyline, the MCG and AAMI Stadium. Renowned for its distinctive blend of Spanish Mission design and Hollywood glamour as much as for its heritage as a haven for a host of famous artists and writers, this is an exceedingly rare opportunity in a tightly held enclave.
Bathed in natural light, the beautifully proportioned living room with library alcove and gas fireplace and the equally spacious dining room, also warmed by a gas fireplace, feature ornate Art Deco ceilings and Spanish Mission style spiralled columns. The gourmet kitchen boasting stainless steel appliances and a casual dining area enjoy wonderful city views. Overlooking the Yarra River and with views to the city and sports precinct, the exceptionally generous main bedroom with ample built in robes and storage is accompanied by a stylish bathroom.
Encompassing an expansive sun-drenched terrace on an exclusive license agreement including studio/loft, chic bathroom, study, laundry and ample storage, as well as an allocated car-space and access to the famous communal pool, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity in a coveted location walking distance to Toorak Road's boutiques and restaurants and the Botanic Gardens.
